betterquesting:10.name:8: The Start of a New Adventure
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Welcome to §9§9§9§b§b§b§b§b§b§l§l§l§l§l§lSupersymmetry§r§r§r§r§r§r! 
You probably opened the questbook because you want to know how to proceed, so we will teach you how.

If this was any other pack we will tell you to get 4 logs of wood or whatever, but §l§l§l§l§l§§§6§6§6§6§6§6§leverything is Gregified§r§r§r§r§r§r§r§r§r§r§r§r, so you can't punch wood. 

So you have to start by getting §6a rock§r. When you pick up a rock from the ground, press the §l§l§l§l§l§l§a§a§a§a§a§a[SUBMIT]§r§r§r§r§r§r button to complete the quest and continue.

If you lose this questbook, you can check the quests by pressing the §2§aGRAVE §rkey (the one to the right of the L key).

----------------------------------------
§3WELCOME TO SUPERSYMMETRY!
§r----------------------------------------
§r- Find shelter
- Prepare for the winter
- Acquire basic resources
- Try not to die
------------------------------------

betterquesting:10.name:8: It's JEI, not NEI. Use it wisely.
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
It is probably impossible to try to play GregTech without using JEI. So here are some tips on how to use JEI to its full potential.

§eBookmark items regularly§r (default key §aA§r) so you don't have to type the names over and over.

Most of the items have §emultiple recipes§r! Dont stop at the first recipe and think that item is impossible.
Sometimes a material is only available from §etiny dusts§r, sometimes it's available from a §efluid solution§r. It takes some practice. Oil processing and nuclear chemistry are pretty bad about this.

You can §epress @§r to see only items from that mod. For example, if you search for §c@gregtech§r, you will only see items from GregTech.

You can §epress $ §rto see only items from a specific entry in the Ore Dictionary. For example, if you search for §c$logWood§r, you will only see wooden logs.

You can §epress U §ron an item to see its uses.

§aSerene Seasons§r is a mod that adds more §mpain§r realism to Minecraft by adding a critical mechanic:

-§aSeasons§r. You are only able to grow some crops in certain seasons (but you can change that using a §agreenhouse§r, or with automated farming), and the environment around you will change throughout the year. The game starts in mid spring, or in April.

To get started on your journey, you will need §6flint shards§r. 

You can get flint shards by first getting a piece of flint (it's a 10% chance of getting it from gravel), and then cutting it with stone. (§aRight-Click §ron a block of stone when having a flint in hand)
The §lAkashic Tome §ris a neat tool that contains §lall guidebooks in the game§r! We have decided to gift it to you, for free, and you can get it by clicking the §acheckbox §ron the right.

You can use that flint you found to make your §efirst too§rl, a §eflint knife§r. You can use it for cutting things, such as making things into shards, or getting §aplant fibers§r§r, which we will see in the next quest. You can also use the flint knife as a weapon.

Also, if you want to survive, you might want to get near a river so you don't die of thirst.

You can use your shiny new §eflint knife§r to make plant fibers. 

You can get §aplant fibers§r by breaking §2tall grass §rwith your flint knife.
You can pack those §aplant fibers§r into §aplant string§r.

betterquesting:10.name:8: The part where you get wood
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Now that you have §aplant fibers§r, you can use it to construct a new tool: the §6Flint Hatchet§r! We can now get wood.

You have found out that you can use flint to develop new §6weapons§r.
All you can think of are a sword and a bow, but they'll suffice for now.
Using our §6crafting table §rwe can now construct better tools, a §6flint pickaxe §rfor mining ores and a §6flint shovel §rfor digging sand or gravel.

You discover that there are many useful resources underground, so you figure you should be looking around for them. 
The first really big thing you need to look for is §l§amagnetite§r. It will be used in magnets (duh) later.

Magnetite is found in really big §aveins§a §runderground on Earth, and the veins are about 15x15 blocks in size. If you find a §atiny pile of magnetite §ron the surface, it will indicate that there is a deposit underground.
You can kill some §acows§r or other animals to get §aleather§r. It will be useful for getting your first set of §earmor§r, so you will only die 50 times instead of 60. ;)

The vanilla §efurnace §ris a very primitive smelting device that allows you to cook things up to a temperature of §c1,000 §rK (727° C), just enough to make§6 copper §rand §7tin§  (and enough to cook a very delicious pizza)

§rWe'll tell you how to mine those ores later, for now you can just make the furnace.

Ahhh, copper. The most important material in all of modded minecraft.

Remember having to use 12 different copper ores in the same modpack? We have this too! And it's intended.

The ores that contain copper are:
§6Chalcopyrite
Chalcocite
Malachite
Bornite
§6Tenorite
Tetrahedrite
§ror just the normal §6Copper Ore§r.

These are found pretty much everywhere, underground and they're really common. By the way, if you want to know how to find an ore, look it up in JEI, you will find a page showing where it is found and in which vein. Let's start by getting 20 copper ingots.
If you find a §6Tiny Pile of Copper Dust §ron the ground, this means there is a deposit under it. Let's get digging!

To tier up, we will need §7tin§r.

GregTech(TM) replaces the normal ore generation with a new, realistic and much more complicated one. So instead of just Tin Ore, there are multiple ores that contain tin. We have decided to list them out here so you don't get confused.

Those are: §6Cassiterite Sand§r, §6Cassiterite Ore§r§r§r, §rand just normal §6Tin Ore§r. They are found near §cdeserts §rand §6rivers§r. 
(Well, they can be found everywhere, but you have a 7x higher chance of finding them near rivers, and a 3x higher chance near deserts.)
§6
§l§rGregTech(TM) ore deposits are§l fucking huge§r, some of them containing up to §a§l5000 ores§r§r§r§r§l§r. When you find one, make sure to bookmark it in JourneyMap!

GregTech ore deposits contains four varieties of ore, they are normal ores, poor, rich and pure. Rich and pure ores cannot be smelted in a furnace, but you can turn them to dust using a mortar. Let's start by getting 20 ingots of tin.

The §amortar§r§r can be used for crushing ores and ingots into §bdusts§r. Let's make one! 
You need to use stone and flint for it.

§lNote: GregTech tools are always shown as Darmstadtium tools in recipes and quests. If something requires a mortar, you can use any kind of mortar, even one made with flint.

§6Copper §rand §7tin§r are good, but you know what's better? Both of them, at the same time.

Crush the metals using a §amortar §rand mix the dusts in a §acrafting table§r in a 3 to 1 ratio. to make §6bronze dust§r. Smelt that up in a furnace, and you've got your first ingot of bronze!

§3This will unlock Tier 1.

You may have noticed that this pack has §e§lDynamic Darkness§r installed. This means when night falls, §cyou can't see!§r
In this pack, mobs have been enhanced to be much more painful and faster than vanilla mobs, at this stage of the game you are nowhere near ready for killing any of them, so you must hide.

The §agrindstone §rfrom Applied Energistics 2 will help you §bduplicate ores§r. It's not that good... but it's a start. It's also §cmanual§r, so you have to power it using your hands.

Put a §6Wooden Crank §ron the grindstone and press §aright click §ron it to rotate it. After a few seconds, the ore will have turned into dust.

When you put 1 ore in, you will get §c2 dusts§r back. You put those in a furnace to get two ingots.
Break §2leaves§r with §6flint§r or a flint knife will drop a stick. (You need to use normal flint, not flint shards)

Let's start by constructing a §l§7§lCoke Oven§r.

The Coke Oven is a hollow 3x3x3 structure made of Coke Bricks with a Coke Oven Controller in the center. The multiblock turns §7Coal §rinto §7Coal Coke§r, and Logs into Charcoal.

Coal Coke burns longer in furnaces, and in small coal boilers. 

§3This will unlock the Multiblock Madness tab.

You thought having three different wrenches was a lot? Now §bwe have seven§r.
All you have to do is thank Greg for this masterpiece of engineering. §9§n[Press this button to pray to Greg]

§rAnyway, let's start making some GregTech tools. Since we can't get iron, we'll have to do with §6bronze§r.
The §2hammer §ris used kind of everywhere. It's used to make all the other tools and it turns ingots into plates
The §2file§r turns ingots into rods.
The §2saw §rturns wood planks into slabs, and turns logs into 4 planks. Finally!
The §2screwdriver§r is used in most recipes and in setting up covers. It also makes important parts like gears and rotors.
The §2wrench§r is used in cutting pipes, it's probably the most important tools out of all of them.
The §2wire cutter§r cuts wires (duh)
The §2bending cylinder §rmakes curved plates§r.

§lSometimes, JEI shows that you need darmstadtium, or aluminum tools. That is a bug, and recipes accept all kinds of tools.§r

You see that your §lfurnace§r isn't really good at smelting things, so we'll need something better. Let's start with making the §c§lprimitive blast furnace§r!

Okay, so let's start by making §cfireclay bricks§r, we'll need 36 of them. Once you have your fireclay bricks, it is time to assemble the primitive blast furnace. You need to make a §a3x4x3 structure§r§r of firebricks that is hollowed out in the middle. For more help, look at the §cMultiblock Preview§r in JEI.

The Primitive Blast Furnace allows you to smelt iron, wrought iron and §bsteel§r. It has a maximum temperature of about 1400 K (1,127°C).
Like many other GregTech multiblocks, it is possible to share the walls of multiple Primitive Blast Furnaces and they will still work.

§l§e§lNOTE: Making the Primitive Blast Furnace requires a steam compressor and a steam macerator. Please check the Industrial Age tab to continue.

§7Sphalerite §rveins contain §7sphalerite ore§r, an important source of zinc. It's found on Earth in Y levels 30 to 70, and in the Nether at Y levels 80 to 120.


You will need zinc really soon because it will be used to create magnets, but if you can't find zinc you can also use an alternate recipe using magnetite ore.

To make magnets, you have to craft a §bVoltaic Pile§r. §cYes, you cannot do it with just an iron rod and 4 pieces of redstone. We're §mevil§r §crealistic§r.
§r
A Voltaic Pile is made of three components: a §6Copper Plate§r, a §7Zinc Plate§r (you can make those with the hammer), and a piece of §bpaper soaked in electrolytes§r. The Electrolyte Paper is just made with paper and §alime§r/§§§elemon§r juice (the fruits are found in jungle trees).

Good luck!

To proceed, we will need §liron§r. Lots of it.
There are multiple ores that contain iron, and these are:
§6Magnetite
Pyrite§r§6
Banded Iron
Yellow Limonite
Brown Limonite
§6Basaltic Mineral Sand
Granitic Mineral Sand
§ror just §6Pure Iron Ore§r.
They're pretty common veins. Let's get 64 ingots of iron.

We've waited long enough, it's finally time for magnets!
First of all, you need a §chot iron rod§r - you make it by smelting a normal iron ingot in a furnace, then making it into a rod (with the file).

There are two ways of making magnets:
Putting a hot iron rod with a §cmagnetite chunk§r in a crafting table, 
or using the §cvoltaic pile §r(it doesn't get consumed) along with some §ccopper fine wire§r.§l

Here's the best part: you only need to do it once§r. You can use your §cmagnetic iron rod § to magnetise other hot iron rods so don't throw it out!

§3This will unlock the Industrial Age.
§7Magnetite §rores can be broken up into §7magnetite chunks§r (just put the magnetite ore in a crafting table). They are another component used for magnets.
We can make better tools out of §6bronze§r. These are GregTech tools, so you need to make the tool parts first, and then make the tool.

Now that we have bronze, we can make better weapons.
Our options are now §6bronze swords§r (from GregTech)

Your Primitive Blast Furnace can turn iron ingots into §l§esteel§r, by smelting them with coal coke. 
Making steel is one of the top priorities of the Industrial Age, because you will need §la lot §rof it. Make sure to have your Primitive Blast Furnace running at all times, or try to make 4 Primitive Blast Furnaces sharing their walls.

§rCongratulations, you made it!§r You completed the Primitive Age.

Your goal for the Industrial Age is to obtain steam machines, making vacuum tubes and getting electricity in the form of RF.

The following information will be critical to your survival, so read it carefully!


§l§nHow do I get steam?§r
There are different ways to produce steam, there is the §c§cCoal Boiler§r,§c Lava Boiler§r, the §cSolar Boiler§r, and the §cLarge Boilers§r. We can't make them right now so we'll start with the coal boiler.
The Coal Boiler is powered by §cfurnace fuels§r and is extremely fuel efficient. It will take some time to heat up, and once hot enough it will §c§rconsume water§r and §c§rautomatically output steam§r into connected pipes. Remember that boilers can §4§l§nexplode§r when they're already hot, have no water and you add some water.

§l§nHow do Steam machines work?§r
§n§l§rSteam machines are §6slow§r, §6need pipe connection§r, and §6do not auto-output§r.
They also have an §6exhaust vent§r, represented by a gray square on their backside by default. 
This vent can be moved using a wrench, but §6must remain unblocked§r. 
When a recipe is completed, the vent will start shooting steam particles in the air, and if you're standing near the vent, you will be §c§lboiled alive!

§r----------------------------------------
§3STAGE ONE HAS BEEN UNLOCKED. GOOD LUCK!
§r----------------------------------------
§r- Industrialize
- Use the power of steam
- Start producing electricity
- Create the most basic electronics

Tier : 1 
EU/t : 0 
------------------------------------

The §l§rSteam Alloy Smelter §rdirectly combines dusts or ingots into §c§lnew alloys.

§rThis machine requires a fair amount of steam to work. If you ever run out of steam, turn this machine off with a §aSoft Hammer§r and let steam build up again.

The §6Alloy Smelter§r can make bronze for you directly, using §dingots§o§o§r, dusts, or even nuggets.§r You can make a nugget mold as well to turn ingots into nuggets. This machine might also come in handy when processing raw rubber.

NOTE: Like all steam machines, the output port doubles as a steam outlet when recipes complete. §cIt must not be blocked§r. Also, steam is hot, remember? Change the output side by whacking the Alloy Smelter with a wrench.

The §6Steam Macerator §ris used to convert ores into crushed ores. This is the most simple way of doing ore processing.
Every ore you put into the Steam Macerator turns into 2 crushed ores, that can be smelted in the furnace to get two ingots.

Making the macerator will require §bdiamonds§r, which are found in graphite deposits. You can check JEI to see where they are.

§6Molds§o§r can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes.
They can be used for turning dusts into ingots, or ingots into gears, using the alloy smelter.§r

betterquesting:10.name:8: I swear to God it's not Constantan
betterquesting:10.desc:8: §6Cupronickel §ris required to advance to the next section of the Industrial Age. This alloy can only be made in an alloy smelter, and it's made with one part copper and one part nickel.

§6Brass §ris made out of §6three powders of copper §rand §7one of zinc§r in a crafting table. Smelt it in a furnace to get the ingot.
It will be used for vacuum ejectors.

§dNickel§r is found in §6Garnierite§r, §6Pentlandite§r, §6§rand plain old §6Nickel §rores. They are in the Beneath, at Y levels 80 to 140.

It will be required for our next big project (§6electricity§r), so let's start excavating!

The §lSteam Mixer§r is a steam machine that mixes items and fluids together. It will be needed for making vacuum.

§cNOTE: Recipes in JEI display EU/t which refers to electric machines. Steam machines can perform these recipes up to 31 EU/t.§r
The §aSteam Compressor §rcompresses things. It can turn ingots into blocks, as well as nuggets to ingots.

The §l§r§6Steam Forge Hammer §ris an extremely useful machine that will do pretty much any recipe that requires a hammer.

§r§r§r§l§rIt can make §6plates §r§l§rat a better ratio, only requiring 1.5 ingots instead of 2 per plate.

To continue with Immersive Engineering, we'll need an Engineer's Workbench.
It makes things using §bblueprints§., and it's made using treated wood. (You can get creosote from the Coke Oven.)

§rThe most important blueprints that we'll need will be the one for §bbasic circuits§r, as it allows us to make vacuum tubes.

If you can't find your Engineer's Manual anymore, try getting it from the Akashic Tome quest in the first chapter of the book.

§cRed Alloy§r is a highly conductive alloy made out of redstone and §ecopper§r. It can only be made in the alloy smelter.

You can find §4Redstone Ore §rin the overworld, at Y levels 15 to 35. If you find redstone rocks on the surface, this means that there will be a deposit underground. Let's get digging!

Congratulations, [INSERT PLAYER NAME HERE]! You made it past the easy part. Now it's time for the hard part.  

As I said in the beginning quest, the main objective of the Industrial Age is §evacuum tubes§r, which are kind of complicated and confusing to set up.
Our first step is making §aglass tubes§r, with a ball mold and glass dust.

Now it's time to actually add the metal parts into our glass tube. We'll do it using the §bengineer's workbench§r.
After this, we only have one final step before we finished our vacuum tube!

To make vacuum tubes, we must obviously get vacuum. The easiest way to make it in the Steam Age is by using the §6steam mixer§r and §6vacuum ejectors§r.

Vacuum ejectors are a clever machine that makes vacuum only by using steam.

Remember that steam needs to be §apiped into the steam mixer§r to make vacuum, so it becomes a challenge to automate it! And yes, you NEED to automate it, or this modpack becomes a grindfest.

In this modpack, there are §afive§r different types of vacuum. To make vacuum tubes, you need the highest one.

The vacuum crafting chain starts with §9§alow vacuum§r, which is made using a vacuum ejector and the steam mixer. 

Then there's §2medium vacuum§r, which is made with another round of the steam mixer and the vacuum ejector.

Then there's §bhigh vacuum§r, §6ultra high vacuum§r and finally §cextremely high vacuum§r. You need the extremely high vacuum to make vacuum tubes.

Yes, this is a very painful 5 step chain. If you don't want to use pumps to automate it (steam machines can't transfer fluids on their own), you can make a §6Vacuum Ejector Cascade§r that will do the entire thing in one go, but it will take a bit longer.

The §9Engineer's Hammer§r is required for making Immersive Engineering multiblocks. 

Another important tool we need is the §aProjector §rfrom Immersive Tech. It allows us to see how you actually make the multiblock. 
We'll need to make the Bottling Machine soon, so we'll need it.

§cNOTE: Electricity is required to progress from now on. If you haven't done it yet, you need to start getting magnets (The process is in the Primitive Age tab)

The §bBottling Machine§r is a 3x2x3 multi-block. It is used to fill liquid containers.

The Bottling Machine requires:

3 Steel Scaffolding
2 Iron Sheetmetal
1 Redstone Engineering Block
2 Light Engineering Blocks
3 Conveyor Belts
1 Fluid Pump
1 Glass

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help. The guide on the bottling machine is in the §7§6Simple Machinery §rchapter.

After putting together the structure, whack the middle conveyor with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.
If the bottling machine doesn't form, you may try switching the order of the conveyors. 

The Bottling Machine has no GUI. Redstone Flux is supplied on the §6top-right§r block of the multi-block (where the Light Engineering Block was).
If you cannot get fluid to go in the machine, try putting a tank near it and using a §7LV Pump §rand fluid pipes to transfer the fluid.

Fluids are added through the bottom-middle block of the backside. Items are added by dropping them on the Bottling Machine's Conveyor Belts. When a liquid storing item (such as a Bucket or Jerrycan) is introduced to the Bottling Machine, the Bottling Machine will fill and output it, consuming some RF.

{ResourceLocation:supersymmetry:guides/ie-bottler.png}

We'll need a §amotor §rto generate electricity. Let's make one.

§cNOTE: In later stages of the pack, you will need to make a LOT of motors. You should start crafting a batch of motors instead of just one, to reduce the pain.

Our first option for electricity right now is §6kinetic energy§r. You can make it with a §6kinetic dynamo§r.

You can attach a §ewindmill §ror a §bwaterwheel §rto your kinetic dynamo. We'll explain those in a later quest.

The §bWater Wheel§r must be connected to a §3flowing water stream§r in order to work, and the amount of power produced scales directly with the number of flowing water blocks adjacent to the wheel. 

The maximum amount of power that a Water Wheel can produce is §c30 RF/t§r, which arises from a water source flowing "in a semi-circle from the top down one side and along the bottom."

You can put up to three Water Wheels on one dynamo to maximize energy output.

The §eWindmill§r generates §cRF§r using the power of the wind. The power output can be improved by using a §eWindmill Sail§r on the hub to cover a single blade in fabric. The Windmill reaches maximum output (§c35 RF/t§r) once all 8 blades are improved this way. The Windmill also generates more power when it's raining or thundering.

The §d§cThermoelectric Generator§r generates §cRF§r based on the temperature difference of the blocks surrounding it.

The §chigh-temperature§r and §blow-temperature§r blocks need to be across from each other. For example, you can put a block of water and a block of lava right next to the generator,

Finally, this is the last step of the vacuum tube chain!
You just need to combine the two things together.

Put the §bunfinished vacuum tube §rin the bottling machine, and add the §cextremely high vacuum§r in the fluid input.

You've done it!

Macerating is still an ore doubler like in other mods, but there is a twist, it does not give dusts directly! Crushed Ores are meant for more advanced ore processing. One Crushed Ore will convert to one dust.

To get the Impure Dust§r, hammer the Crushed Ore. 

This is done either by using a Hammer tool in the crafting table, or using the Steam Forge Hammer.

The Impure Dust can be smelted in the Furnace to get the Ingot, however mixed ores (Limonite, Chalcopyrite) will only give nuggets over ingots.

The Impure Dust can also be thrown in a vanilla Cauldron filled with water to clean it and turn it into a regular dust. Throw them in full stacks to consume less water per single dust.

§lNote: Macerating, hammering, and then smelting (sometimes into nuggets) is really time consuming in the steam age! Resource efficiency can be ignored for now. Nobody will blame you for smelting ores directly into ingots.

GregTech's §ehigh pressure §rsteam machines require steel and they're two times faster than normal steam machines. Let's make a Steel Hull to get started.

You can also make high pressure §r§eboilers§r to generate steam twice as fast.
We can also use §4lava §rto boil steam. Let's make a Lava Boiler.

§6Solar boilers §rcan be used to get steam, for free, using the power of the sun. 
But there's a catch: they only work while the sun is up, 13 hours per day.

This pack has three different options for tanks:

- §6GregTech Tanks§r: they can be made of various materials, and you can combine multiple GT tanks to make a bigger tank

- §6Immersive Engineering tanks§r: they have a bigger capacity, but you can't combine them like GT tanks

- §6Industrial Renewal tanks§r: they are harder to build, but they can contain more fluid.

For now, let's make a GregTech bronze tank.

You've probably noticed the outside world is very dangerous at night. Mobs are everywhere. 

But here at Shoot, Inc. we have a solution! Our §bRevolver§r can shoot things much more efficiently than your average hunting bow!

The revolver requires §acartridges §rto be used. An unmodified revolver can hold 8 of them at once, but you can increase that with upgrades.

Cartridges for the revolver can be made in the Engineer's Workbench. We've got things like the §9Casull§r cartridge, that deals a lot of damage, the §9Armor Piercing§r cartridge that rips armor in half, and the §cHigh-Explosive§r cartridge that goes boom really fast.
In the Industrial Age you are able to produce better weapons. The §aHandcannon §ris one of those. It uses stone bullets for ammunition.

The §aDouble Barrel Shotgun§r is the first ever gun that you can make. It uses §aShotgun Rounds §o§rfor ammo.

It's a shotgun, this means it will shoot 8 times at once. For more info, look at the tooltip.

This modpack actually has two types of revolvers, the one from §6TechGuns§r, and the one from §6Immersive Engineering§r. 
The §TTechGuns revolver is the easiest one to make and use, and it uses §6Pistol Rounds §rfor ammo.
Resistors are another major component of §bLV circuits§r. They are made with sticky resin, which can be found on §2rubber trees§r, or you can get it by smelting slimeballs.

§6Coated circuit boards§r are another component of LV circuits. They are made with sticky resin, and wood planks.

You have to coat the board with wires to make it usable, turning it into a §6Basic Circuit Board§r.

Assembling the circuit parts (§6resistors§r, §bvacuum tubes§r, §cwiring§r, and the §2board§r) gets you one Primitive Circuit. 

Circuits are the brain of all GregTech machines - they're needed for the machine to work. This modpack has over 10 different tiers of circuits, ranging all the way from a simple tube on a wood plank all the way to a 200 step reality bending supracausal circuit. 

Congratulations! We are proud of you, and you can officially say that you finished the first tier. To progress further, we will need to generate EU electricity, but we'll explain that in a later quest.

§l§3This quest will unlock Tier 2.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aEarth§r
Dimension ID: §a0§r
Day length: §624 hours§r (20 minutes IRL)
Year length: §6360 days§r (120 hours IRL)
Spawns mobs: zombies, soldiers, raiders, aggressive animals
-------------------------

Hospitable and resource rich planet, the player spawns and spends all the time up to EV tier here, villagers are the only indigenous population, soldiers with advanced gear can be found in buried derelict spaceships, as if they came from a civilisation in an early space age to establish permanent colonies here, only to remain abandoned when their civilisation fell, they have remnants of basic ME systems, explosives and heavy firearms.


The planet hosts a virus that turns its host into an agressive zombie, which still retains some hability to use weapons. Fortunately this virus is not airborne and can only be contracted via direct contact with the zombies themselves.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aEarth§r
Dimension ID: §a10§r
Day length: §624 hours§r (20 minutes IRL)
Year length: §6360 days§r (120 hours IRL)
Depth: §c65 meters§r
Spawns mobs: Poisonous spiders, zombies, Weeping Angels
-------------------------
§4Dig down to bedrock from the Overworld to access this dimension.§r

A completely dark cave dimension with an abundance of ore, barely anything survives down here, only smaller poisonous spiders and the occasional zombie who wanders too deep into caves, the shadows themselves are carnivorous, dungeons can be found here in the form of ruined mineshafts built by the first colonists who tried to conquer this world, these are partially collapsed but can be rebuilt to become safe and fast ways to travel between the overworld, the beneath, and the nether.
§r
§bThey're coming. The angels are coming for you but listen; your life could depend on this. Don't blink, don't even blink! Blink and you're dead. They're fast, faster than you can believe. Don't turn your back, don't look away, and don't blink! Good Luck.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aEarth§r
Dimension ID: §a-1§r
Day length: §624 hours§r (20 minutes IRL)
Year length: §6360 days§r (120 hours IRL)
Depth: §c323 meters§r
Spawns mobs: Vanilla nether mobs, cyberdemons
-------------------------
§4Dig down to bedrock from the Beneath to access this dimension.§r
The Nether, not intended as a literal hell but as a deep undeground cave system full of strange creatures, the mineshafts reach down here as well, lava can be extracted and pumped up to the overworld for use as a geothermal power source.

The soldiers who tried coming here all became trapped when the mineshafts connecting to the surface collapsed, they were killed by the local wildlife, who posseses sufficient intelligence to learn how to operate their weapons, making this place extremely dangerous.

Heat is dangerous here, the lava makes the entire dimension incredibly hot, it’s not possible to survive long without proper equipment to cool down.

§3WARNING: Due to technical limitations, your internal clock will not work while in the Nether. Compasses also don't work.
§4§lWARNING: Due to extreme heat, water buckets do not work in the Nether. Use bottles.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aMoon§r (Orbits §2Earth§r)
Dimension ID: §a8§r
Day length: §630 Earth days§r (10 hours IRL)
Doesn't spawn mobs
-------------------------
Peaceful but not hospitable environment, relatively rich in Aluminium, Iron, Magnesium and Titanium. Lava tubes should spawn as a geological feature and provide a good environment to build a permanent base.
With rockets being expensive, the Moon is a good place to set up launch equipment for asteroid mining missions, which are required to get access to ME systems, mining the local ores is also encouraged, as they give more of the resources necessary for progression than their Earth counterparts.


§3WARNING: Due to technical restrictions, your internal clock will not work while on the Moon.

The §bMetal Press§r is a 3x1x3 multi-block. It is used to mold metals, and it makes plates at a higher efficiency.

The Metal Press requires:

2 Steel Scaffoldings
1 Redstone Engineering Block
1 Piston
1 Heavy Engineering Block
2 Conveyor Belts

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help. The guide on the metal press is in the §7§6Simple Machinery §rchapter.

After putting together the structure, whack the middle conveyor with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.
Items are added by dropping them onto the structure. Right-clicking (a Metal Press with a Mold will attach the Mold to the Metal Press. The mold can be detached by shift right-clicking with an Engineer's Hammer.

{ResourceLocation:supersymmetry:guides/ie-metalpress.png}

The §6Tesla Coil§r protects a 13x13x13 area by shocking mobs that enter the area. 
In order to protect the area, the Tesla Coil needs to consume §c256 RF/t§r, and needs to consume 512 RF each time it shocks a mob.

The Tesla Coil must be powered by §cRedstone§r in order to function. This can be inverted by right-clicking the Tesla Coil with an Engineer's Hammer.
The Tesla Coil's §6electricity damage§r will cook animal meat, but it will not create charged creepers.

By default, the Tesla Coil is in high-power mode. §2Shift-clicking §rthe coil will turn it into low-power mode, which consumes half the power but with only half the range. If you change the mode of the coil while it's active, you will §c§ndie instantly.§r

Wearing a §bFaraday suit§r near a low-power Tesla Coil will prevent any damage being caused to the user, but wearing a Faraday suit near a high-power Tesla Coil will increase the damage.

Don't like your enemies? We have a solution for you!

The Industrial Renewal(TM) §6Electric Fence §rwill roast any player or mob that comes into contact with it.
You can use electricity to light up stuff. We have §6floodlights §rand §6powered lanterns §rfor electric lighting.

This pack has two different types of electricity: §cRF (Redstone Flux) §rand §bEU (Energy Units)§r§r. What we are going to use in the Industrial Age is RF. 

In the next tier, we will unlock EU and GregTech machines, and we will explain the EU system in more detail there.

Remember that 16 RF equals 1 EU, and if GregTech machines get a higher voltage that they can handle, they will explode. To convert between RF and EU you will need to use energy converters. 

------------------
To store RF, you need to make a §cLow Voltage Capacitor. §r
To transfer RF, you need to use §cLow Voltage RF wire§r. Make a LV Wire Coil, and connect it to a LV Wire Connector to transfer the energy.

Don't get confused between Immersive Engineering electricity and GregTech electricity. Immersive Engineering LV and GregTech LV are two completely different things, so don't mix them up.
Immersive Engineering's §6conveyors §rcan be used for moving things around in your base. You can change the orientation of a Conveyor using the §6Engineer's Hammer§r.

The IE §bAssembler§r is a 3x3x3 multi-block. It is used to assemble things together (duh)

It requires:

9 Iron Sheetmetal, 
6 Steel Scaffoldings,
6 Iron Sheetmetal Slabs, 
2 Redstone Engineering Blocks, 
2 Light Engineering Blocks and 2 Conveyor Belts

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help. The guide on the metal press is in the §7§6Simple Machinery §rchapter.

After putting together the structure, whack it with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

Recipes can be set inside of the Assembler, as seen to the right. The fluid tanks in the Assembler will automatically fill liquid containers used in recipes, such as Water Buckets. It will automatically craft the recipes if it has the correct materials.

{ResourceLocation:supersymmetry:guides/ie-assembler.png}

The §3Distillation Tower§r is a large 4x16x4 multiblock used to process fluids into other fluids. 

It can be used to process oil into other things. In the LV age you can do this in one machine (the Distillery), but we can't do that now.

Remember that we also have another distillation tower, but that is unlocked at MV. That one can extract up to 12 things out of one fluid.

The Distillation Tower requires:

25 Steel Scaffolding
33 Steel Scaffolding Slab
17 Fluid Pipes
60 Iron Sheetmetal
4 Heavy Engineering Blocks
1 Redstone Engineering Block

If you want to know how to build it, look at the schematic in the §6Engineer's Manual§r. After completing the structure, whack it with an §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

The port on the back of the Distillation Tower is used to input the fluids. §cRedstone Flux (RF)§r is inputted from the top of the furnace located on the back of the multiblock. Bitumen is output through the port on the front of the machine, and the outputs on the bottom side. The multiblock's processes can be halted via Redstone through the control panel with the red dot.

The §3IE Boiler§r is a 5x3x3 multiblock used to boil water using oil products, to get steam.

The Boiler requires:

10 Steel Scaffolding
10 Fluid Pipes
18 Iron Sheetmetal
4 Heavy Engineering Blocks
1 Redstone Engineering Block

If you want to know how to build it, look at the schematic in the §6Engineer's Manual§r. After completing the structure, whack it with an §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

You can use many different fluids to boil water and get steam. Look up the Boiler on JEI and press U to see which fluids you can use. They are mostly made using the distillation tower.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§3This is a side quest. It's not necessary for progression!§r

Before establishing a railroad empire, it's a good idea to ensure a robust supply of Steel, Treated Wood, and electrical power.

Create a §b§bLarge Wrench§r, and a §bTrack Blueprint§r. These tools are essential to progress and construction through Immersive Railroading.

The §bCasting Basin§r creates different parts for rolling stock, specifically wheels and frames, as well as the Rail Cast for use with the Track Roller. The Gauge selector changes between gauges.

§bImmersive Railroading multiblocks are HUGE, so we can't show an image preview.

§rThe Casting Basin requires:

114 Stone Bricks
15 Heavy Engineering Block
126 Sand
86 Blast Brick
63 Steel Scaffolding
1 Block of Steel (If the multiblock doesn't form, try using an Immersive Engineering block of steel. You can change between the different types using a Chisel.)

Use the §6Immersive Railroading manual §rto see how to form the structure.

Power is input through the top of the machine, on the color-coded yellow/orange block.

To create a selected part, drop Steel Blocks or Steel Ingots into the Basin and make sure it has power. The part will be created in short order - right-click on the Basin to retrieve the part.

Parts made in the casting basin can be recycled by dropping them back into the basin.

The §6Track Roller§r is used to create track pieces for use with Track Blueprints.

The Track Roller requires a clear, level space that is 30 blocks deep, 2 blocks wide, and 3 blocks tall. When placed, the short side will be facing the player, and offset 1 block to the right. After placing, right-click with a Large Wrench anywhere on the arrangement of blocks to assemble the machine.

It is built from:

44 Steel Scaffolding
16 Heavy Engineering Block
32 Light Engineering Block


The Track Roller requires power to operate, which can be input at the top of the multiblock (it must be §cRF§r, not EU)
To make tracks, you need to make a §6Rail Casting§r first from the §6Casting Basin§r.

The §6Steam Hammer§r is used to process some parts before they are placed onto a Frame. It is the smallest machine in Immersive Railroading, it's 5 blocks in width, 1 in depth, and 6 in height.

It is built from:

3 x Heavy Engineering Block
1 x Block of Steel (If the multiblock doesn't form, try using an Immersive Engineering block of steel. You can change the types using a chisel)
1 x Piston
10 x Light Engineering Block

Operating the Steam Hammer requires power, which is input through the top block. 
To operate the hammer, right-click the central block to open the GUI. 

{ResourceLocation:supersymmetry:guides/steamhammer.jpg}

Place down at least 20 blocks of track end-to-end to have enough space to place a Frame on the rails, which is created in the §6Casting Basin. §r

With the Frame in hand, right-click the rail to place it. Then, with the Large Wrench in hand, right-click the Frame. I
t will list the parts needed to complete the piece of stock and which machines are needed in order to make those parts. 

For example, a newly placed A1 Peppercorn Frame will list out that it needs 2 §6Cylinders§r, which are made in the Casting Basin and then processed in the Steam Hammer.

Continuing on with the creation of an A1 Peppercorn, we don't need another machine until we get to the point of creating the engine's firebox and boiler, using the §6Boiler Roller§r and §6Plate Rolling Machine§r.

A word of warning: Steam Engines require a constant water supply when fueled, and if they boil off 75% or more of their water, there is a chance that they will §4explode.

The §6Plate Rolling Machine§r creates Steel Plates and Boiler Plates from Steel Blocks, which are used in the crafting of Locomotives.

It is built from:

41 x Heavy Engineering Block
90 x Steel Scaffolding
88 x Light Engineering Block

The machine uses §cRF power§r.

Steel Blocks are input by right-clicking the machine with the blocks in hand, and Steel Blocks can be placed while a plate is being made, which makes the process a bit more efficient.

The §6Boiler Roller§r turns Boiler Plates created in the Plate Rolling Machine into the needed boiler pieces for a given steam locomotive.

It is built from:

24 x Stone Slab
4 x Heavy Engineering Block
8 x Light Engineering Block

§r
To operate, the machine needs §cRF power§r, which is input through the orange-yellow colored block on the left front of the machine. 
The roller creates the appropriate part automatically - just have a boilerplate in hand and right-click the machine. 

{ResourceLocation:supersymmetry:guides/boilerroller.png}
To make a crafting table you need to get §6planks§o§r. To get planks, you need to right click on the top side of wood logs using your§  §l§cflint hatchet§r.
Kill cows to get §6leather§r. This can be used not only for armor, but also for §6canteens §rso you can store your water.

We should get coal so we can have §bcoal coke §rand §btorches §r(Finally, we can see!)

Coal is found in all biomes§r at Y levels 35 to 115.
The §9Steam Pump §rcan get water from a river or an ocean when you give it steam. It will be very useful for making steam, so let's make one!
The §6Steam Chunk Miner §ris the earliest version of auto-mining in this pack. It will mine every ore in the chunk when you give it §aDrilling Fluid §r(unlocked at LV).

We can't make §6iron buckets§r yet, so we have to make them with clay. Use a §6Clay Tool §r(from NoTreePunching) on a block of clay to get the bucket. Then smelt it in a furnace to fire it and get a §cCeramic Bucket§r.

The §6Steam Extractor §.extracts things (duh).

§rIt will be used for making rubber pulp, which is used in rubber processing and §ccable insulation§r.
To start getting §brubber§r, we will need sticky resin. It's found in §brubber trees §rthat are scattered around the world.
The next step of the chain is §7rubber pulp.§r You get it by putting sticky resin in an §6Extractor§r.

The final step of the chain is combining 6 rubber pulp with 1 §bsulfur §rin an Alloy Smelter, to get 6§6 rubber bars§r.

Sulfur is found in §7sphalerite §rveins in the Overworld and §4the nether§r. For more information, check JEI.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §a§cMars§r
Dimension ID: §a32§r
Day length: §61 Earth day§r (20 minutes IRL)
Doesn't spawn mobs
-------------------------
Necessary for progression, it’s the only planet in the Solar system with dilithium deposits, it’s not hospitable but it also has no hostile lifeforms, ice can be mined as a source of water.

§.

Congratulations, you got your first circuit! That wasn't easy, and I'm proud of you for doing that. :)

Now it's time to move forward and create even better machines. Your §6Steam §rmachines are clunky, don't auto-output, and need pumps to be automated.
Our first step is making a §8§8§7LV Machine Hull.§r Pretty simple, it's just 8 steel and some cables.

----------------------------------------
§b§3STAGE 2 HAS BEEN UNLOCKED! GOOD LUCK.
§r----------------------------------------
- Setup basic automatic defenses
- Dig down to the nether and face its horrors
- Find new and better materials
- Rain fire on your enemies with rockets

Tier: 2
EU/t: 32
-------------

betterquesting:10.name:8: You are going to hate this #1
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The §7LV Electric Piston §ris a very important machine component. You will need A LOT of these, so try to craft like 16 of them at once, to save the pain.

betterquesting:10.name:8: You are going to hate this #3
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Another component you will need is the §7LV Robot Arm§r. It's used in the assembler. It's also extreme fucking pain, and it's arguably the most painful one out of the four.

It's kind of like a conveyor but it can work with selected item slots,

betterquesting:10.name:8: You are going to hate this #2
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The §7LV Electric Pump §ris another important component that you will need to make for LV machines. 

It also acts as a cover and it extracts fluids from tanks or things that don't auto output (like steam machines)

betterquesting:10.name:8: You are going to hate this #4
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The §7LV Conveyor Module §ris the 4th and final basic component that you will need to make for machines. 

It moves things in and out of machines, it's basically a conveyor.

You've made it into the electrical age!

Don't throw away your steam machines, you will probably want to use them until we reach tier 3. 
The quickest and easiest way to generate EU power is by making LV §6steam turbines§r. They run on steam, so you can use the steam you're making in your boiler to power them.

We will explain how EU works in the next quest.

§3If you want to see the quest for machines, complete the EU tutorial.

Gregtech energy consists of §6Voltage§r and §6Amperage§r. Think of amps as being energy packets, that are sent from the generator.

A Low Voltage GT generator will output §632 EU/t§r (that's the voltage) in §61 amp§r.

If you have four generators they will output §632 volts in 4 amps§r together. 

32 volts in 4 amps is not the same thing as MV (Medium Voltage - 128 volts per amp)
This can be compared to four cables containing 32 volts each. Or one 4x Cable.
If you want to be safe just make 16x cables for everything, lol

§3Click on the checkbox to continue the guide.

Let's talk about §4explosions§r.

There are multiple ways GT Electric machines can explode. 

§9Rain§r will make your electric machines explode if the rain hits the machine, so §9put your machinery under a proper roof§r. Wires without insulation will catch fire when they touch rain.

§c§r§4Fire§r will explode your machines if it gets too close.

§6If you give your machines too high voltage they will explode.§r To avoid making this error, I suggest that you make some space between different tiers of machines. 

You should also use different cables for different tiers to avoid mistakes. This means §ldo NOT use MV cables for LV energy§r§r, but it will be a while before we can get to that.

§3Press the checkbox to continue.

Let's talk about energy conversion. There are two types of energy, §cRF §n§rand §eEU§r.

The one you've been using is §cRF§r. We are going to use §eEU §rin the next tier.

To convert between EU and RF you will need an §eenergy converter§r. The conversion rate is 16 to 1, you will generate 1 EU for every 16 RF you make.

Yes, you can still make RF and convert it back into EU, but it's really not efficient right now (Do you really want to make 5 water wheels to generate 30 EU/t?)


§3Click the checkbox to complete the EU tutorial.
This will unlock about 20 quests for machines.
The §2Wiremill §ris one of the most useful machines in the game. It turns 1 ingot into 2 wires (the previous ratio was 2 ingots to 1 wire, which is much worse), and it does it automatically!
The §2Bending Machine§r turns 1 ingot into 1 plate, much more efficient than the Forge Hammer, which used 3 ingots for 2 plates.

The §2Electrolyzer §rseparates compounds into their individual items. For example, §bwater §rturns into hydrogen and oxygen, or §asalt §rturns into sodium and chlorine. This will be used a LOT in GregTech.

You can use the Electrolyzer to separate §dore dusts§r, for example you can extract the aluminum out of green sapphire. Pretty useful, huh?

§3This will unlock the Chemistry tab.
It's a §2mixer§r! You put dusts or liquids in, and it mixes them. It's basically the same thing as the Steam Mixer.

The §2chemical reactor§r... makes chemical reactions. We don't know the exact details of how the chemical reactor works, but just be prepared to make a LOT of them since it's used for about 95% of all chemical processing steps. 

§3This will unlock the Chemistry tab.
The §2distillery §ris basically used to extract fluids out of other fluids. It will be used a lot in oil processing.

The §2cutting machine §ris very useful. It will automate all cutting steps, like rods into bolts, and wood into slabs. 

It needs water to run, but you can also give it lubricant for 2x speed.
Just don't put your arm in it.
Please don't.

The §2§2assembler §rputs things together. It's used everywhere, you really can't go without having an assembler.
Some things that are too complicated to craft by hand in the crafting table can only be crafted with an Assembler.
The §2Lathe §rturns ingots into rods. It's more efficient than doing it by hand, as it gives one rod and a small dust when you give it an ingot.

Do you want to know how to refine gold? If yes, this quest is for you!

You may have noticed that smelting §6precious metal §rto gold isn't really a good idea. It smelts into 1 nugget per ore.
I will teach you how to get more gold out of that. Let's start by getting precious metal dust.
If you follow all 4 steps of the chain, you will get 3 gold ingots for every precious metal you smelt. Pretty cool, huh?
The next step in the chain is §6gold alloy§r. Combine §6precious metal §rand §6copper§r in an alloy smelter to get gold alloy.
Separate §9water §rto get hydrogen and oxygen.
You can get §cnitrogen§r by centrifuging air (use the air collector to get it)
You can electrolyze salt to get §3sodium §rand §achlorine§r, you will need sodium for batteries and chlorine for gold processing. Let's do it!

§2Lithium §rcan be obtained by electrolyzing §7spodumene §r§d§rand§d lepidolite§r. They are both found in the Salt vein, near rivers.

You will need lithium for batteries.

When you hit Tier 3, you can use a MV Electrolyzer to electrolyze §bclay§r.

The §5centrifuge §rseparates fluids by centrifuging them. (Duh)
It will be needed to separate air to get nitrogen.

And you'll also need it for processing tiny piles of Gallium out of crushed Sphalerite Ore for your Diodes needed in good circuits.
Later on you can get Gallium out of centrifuged Sphalerite in the second macerator slot.

§3

The §5air collector §t§rtakes in the air from outside and puts it in its internal tank. You will need it for getting nitrogen.
It makes 1,000 mB of air per second.

§3This will unlock the Cryogenics tab, a step-by-step tutorial to the 10-step Liquid Air chain.
The next step of gold processing is mixing gold alloy with §bnitric acid §rto make §6Gold Leach§r.
§6Hydrochloric acid§r will be needed for a lot of stuff, including circuits. It's made out of hydrogen and chlorine.
Combine 3 hydrogens and 1 oxygen to get §3ammonia§r.
Combine §bammonia §rand §boxygen §rto make §6nitric acid§r. This will be needed in Step 2 of the Gold Processing Chain.

Reacting the §g§6gold leach §rwith §3hydrochloric acid§r will create Leached Copper and §6Chloroauric Acid§r.

You can use the Chemical Dehydrator to get some cool byproducts out of the leached copper (like silver, nickel and lead)

The final step of the gold chain requires us to turn §7chloroauric acid §rinto §6gold dust§r using the chemical reactor.

You'll need to make §7Potassium Metabisulfite§r (Don't worry, it's not that complicated! It's just potassium, sulfur, and oxygen in a mixer. :) )
Then just smelt the dust to make a gold ingot.

§5Potassium §rcan be electrolyzed out of Rock Salt, Glauconite, and Saltpeter. Let's get some.

You will need it for Step 4 of the Gold Chain.
You can make §7Carbon§r by electrolyzing graphite.

GregTech oil processing is kind of complicated, so I will have to explain it to you.
It's a bit daunting for a new player to look up how to get naphtha and see that there are 30 different recipes with 30 different yields, so I will help you get the best one.

First of all, there are 4 different types of oil: Light oil, Heavy oil, Raw Oil and just normal Oil.
The distillery extracts things out of oil. Each type of oil contains around 10 or so products, to choose which one you have to use, you have to put in a Programmed Circuit.

The first thing we will need oil for is §6Naphtha§r, to create our first plastic.

§3Press the checkbox to complete the Oil tutorial.

betterquesting:10.desc:8: The §7programmed circuit§o§r will be used a lot in GregTech. It's used for choosing which recipe you want to do in the distillery or assembler, if there are multiple recipes with the same ingredient.

First of all, let's do a little setup before starting on your journey.

- Make sure you have the latest version of Supersymmetry

- Make sure your download did not get corrupted

- Make sure you downloaded Supersymmetry from a trusted source (our Discord server, GitHub or CurseForge). If you got the pack from sketchy sites like 9minecraft.net your computer isn't safe.

- Make sure you are using the latest version of Java 8. (Java 9 or later won't work.)

- Make sure you haven't modified the pack, added new mods or changed recipes. 

§3§3§3Press the checkbox to start the journey.§r

0:10.command:8:
#Script Comment
say @p has started the modpack. Wish them luck!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
If you want to get oil, you gotta start drilling.
But you can't just go around drilling and try to get lucky and find oil.
You have to start taking samples first.

Let's make a Core Sample Drill. It uses §c40 RF/t §rto take samples of the fluids that are in each chunk. After placing a Core Sample Drill, right click it and wait 10 seconds for the samples to be extracted.

The §bPumpjack§o§o§r is a 6x4x3 multi-block. It extracts fluids like Crude Oil from reservoirs that are below bedrock. You need to have a Core Sample Drill to use it. It requires §41024 RF/t §rto run (§664 EU/t§r)

The Pumpjack requires:

11 Steel Scaffolding
6 Treated Wood Fences
4 Fluid Pipes
4 Steel Sheetmetal
2 Blocks of Steel
2 Light Engineering Blocks
2 Heavy Engineering Blocks
1 Redstone Engineering Block

Once your Pumpjack is powered and an empty pipe is connected to either fluid port, the jack pumps at a rate of 15 mB/tick.

If there's a reservoir below it, it brings the fluid to the surface. Multiple Pumpjacks in one chunk increases the rate of extraction. 
If the reservoir is emptied, up to 6 mB/tick of fluid can continue to be extracted from the drained reservoir using a single Pumpjack.

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help. 
§r
After putting together the structure, whack the Heavy Engineering Block with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

{ResourceLocation:supersymmetry:guides/ie-pumpjack.png}
Use your pumpjack to get §dlight oil§r. This will be needed for plastic.

Use your §2Distillery §rto extract the §6Sulfuric Naphtha§r out of your light oil. 
You need to put 2 on the configuration circuit.

The next step is turning your sulfuric naphtha into normal §6Naphtha§r. 

Just put the sulfuric naphtha in a chemical reactor with hydrogen. 
You need to put a Configuration Circuit set to 0.

§7Polycaprolactam §r(holy shit, that's a long name!) is the first plastic you can use in this game.
You might recognize it by another name: nylon.

You can make it by putting §7Naphtha §rand 1 §6Saltpeter§o§r (found in Saltpeter veins in the Overworld) in a Chemical Reactor.
You can then use the Fluid Solidifier to transform molten Polycaprolactam into a Polycaprolactam ingot.

You did it! I'm proud of you. :)
You see, an §dLV Macerator §ris so much better than a Steam one! Let's make it.

The §dFluid Solidifier §rturns fluids into solids.
For example, you can put in molten copper with an ingot mold and you'll get 1 copper ingot back.
You can make §6Sulfur Dioxide §rby combining §9Oxygen§r and §6Sulfur§r, or by extracting it during oil processing.
Combine §6Sulfur Dioxide §rwith §bHydrogen §rto get §6Sulfuric Acid§r. Just don't put your arm in it...

If you want to store energy, you'll need a §5battery buffer§r. 

There are 4 types of battery buffers available at LV. They contain 1, 4, 8 or 16 batteries. 
For example, the 16x battery buffer can hold 16 batteries, and takes in 16 amps of LV, so you'll have to use a 16x cable to transport the energy.

You can pick whichever you want, but I'd use a 16x battery buffer to run your main LV machine line.

§3You need to make the 16x battery buffer to complete this quest.§r

Now that you have lithium, it's time to make §2batteries§r!

There are 4 types of batteries available at LV: 
§6Acid Battery §r(18,000 EU)§6
Mercury Battery §r(32,000 EU)§7§6
Sodium Battery §r(80,000 EU)§6
Lithium Battery §r(100,000 EU)§6
Cadmium Battery §r(120,000 EU)

The acid and mercury batteries aren't really that good. They only hold about a minute of energy each.
The Cadmium battery is the best, but cadmium is pretty hard to get at this stage, so you'll have to go with lithium, or sodium.

§6Antimony§r is the main component of battery hulls, along with lead.
You can get antimony by smelting §2Stibnite Ore§r, which is found in the Nether in the §cTetrahedrite §rvein, at Y levels 35 to 70.

You will need §5lead §rfor some things in LV. Lead is found in Galena veins in the Overworld. Those veins also contain silver.

Let's get 64 ingots of lead!
Use your pumpjack to get normal§a oil§r. You'll use this for distilling it into §6Fuel§r, I'll explain how to do that later.

§6Light Fuel §ris the first oil-based fuel that you can make in this game. 

It's made by distilling §6Oil§r in a distillery (circuit: 1) to get §6Sulfuric Light Fuel§r, and then putting it into a §2Chemical Reactor§r to get Light Fuel.

1 bucket of Light Fuel makes ~305,000 EU§r, and lasts for 7:56 minutes in a LV combustion generator.
Use your pumpjack to get §7heavy oil§r. You'll use this for distilling it into §6Heavy Fuel §rand then §6Diesel§r. I'll explain how to do that later.

§6Heavy Fuel §rcannot be used in a combustion generator. You have to combine it with Light Fuel to get §6§rDiesel§r. (§3This requires an MV mixer, which is not available right now.§r)

It's made by distilling §6Heavy Oil§r in a distillery (circuit: 0) to get §6Sulfuric Heavy Fuel§r, and then putting it into a §2Chemical Reactor§r to get Heavy Fuel.

§3This quest requires an MV mixer. I just decided to put it in the LV tab because it's convenient.

§r§6Diesel §ris the second tier of fuel that you can make in this game. 

It's made by combining §6Light Fuel §rand §6Heavy Fuel §rin an MV mixer, in a 5 to 1 ratio.

1 bucket of Diesel makes ~480,000 EU§r, and lasts for 12:30 minutes in a LV combustion generat§o§ror, or 3:07 minutes in an MV one.
The §6LV Alloy Smelter§r is an electric version of the alloy smelter. It uses energy instead of steam to do recipes.
The §6LV Diesel Generator §rgenerates energy from fossil fuels like §6Light Fuel §rand §6Diesel§r. Let's make one!

§6Copper §rcables will be used a lot in the next tier, starting with the MV Electric Motor. 
They are insulated with polycaprolactam instead of rubber. Let's make some.
The §6LV Polarizer §rmakes magnets without the need of all that Voltaic Pile stuff. It just uses electricity.
The §6canning machine§r is used for putting things into cans... or into batteries. You'll need it to put the lithium in the battery hulls.

§3Alumino Silicate Wool §ris a required component for the coils in the Electric Blast Furnace, and it's made by combining Silicon Dioxide §r(made by electrolyzing §6Sand§r) and Sapphire. Let's make some.
This is an easier way to make insulation for coils, and it only works for tier 1 coils (Cupronickel).

§3There is another way to make coils, using Mica Ore. Check the Forming Press quest for more info.
This will unlock the EBF.
With the basic forming press you can make different food items, and most importantly §bMica Insulation Sheet §rfor your Electric Blast Furnace.

The arc furnace can smelt stuff back into components and it also makes wrought iron faster than the normal method.

The recipes use oxygen and 2 amperes of power.

Mica Insulator Foils will be needed to make coils for our EBF. The process for making them is quite complicated.

First of all, get §6mica ore§r. It spawns in Y level 0 to 15 in the Beneath.

§
Then, smelt it to get §6mica dust§r§r, and mix it with rubber pulp to get Mica Based Pulp.

Then mix the §6based pulp §rwith §6asbestos§r in a forming press to make mica based sheet. 

Smelt the mica based sheet in an Alloy Smelter with §6silicon dioxide §rto get mica insulation sheets, and turn them into mica insulation foils.
Good luck.

§3There is another way to make coils, using Silicon Dioxide and sapphire. Check the Alloy Smelter quest for more info.§r
§3
This will unlock the EBF.

You can make §6annealed copper§r in the arc furnace.

Annealed copper is a very good material for cables in MV. It only loses 1 EU per block."
The §aThermal Centrifuge§r can get you different byproducts out of your crushed and purified ore dust.

In order to get aluminium ingots, you need an §6electric blast furnace§r. It's THE most important step to get to tier 3, so let's get started.

First of all, the Electric Blast Furnace requires §6120 EU/t§r. That's 4 Amperes of LV, so you'll need 4 generators connected to the 2 energy hatches.

The Electric Blast Furnace is a Multiblock structure. It is §63x4x3§r blocks (3 long, 3 wide, and 4 high)

When building your first EBF, you will need:

1 Electric Blast Furnace
16 Cupronickel Coil Blocks
1 LV input bus (For inputting items and the control circuits)
1 LV input hatch (For inputting fluids- any tier will work)
1 LV output bus (For outputting items- you'll need at least an LV one)
1 Maintenance Hatch (For doing maintenance. We'll explain how that works later, but if you have maintenance problems, your recipes will take longer) 
2 LV Energy Hatches (Each hatch accepts 2 amps)
9-12 Heat Proof Machine Casings

§
Your cupronickel coil blocks can only reach a temperature of §71700 K§r, so you will need higher tier coils to do more advanced recipes. 

Now let's build it.

Start by placing down your controller. It goes in the front middle of the bottom layer. After that, your input hatch, input bus, output bus, your maintenance hatch, and your energy hatches can go anywhere on the bottom layer. Finally, fill in any gaps with heat proof machine casings.

The second and third layers of the EBF are for your 16 cupronickel coils. The inside of the 3x3 should be hollow.

§fFinally, fill in the rest of the top layer with heat proof machine casings.
Getting §7Silicon Dioxide §rmight sound complicated, but it's easy! It's literally just sand in an electrolyzer.

betterquesting:10.name:8: It only gets worse from here...
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
We'll want to smelt some §3aluminium§r now to get ready for Tier 3. 

There isn't pure aluminium ore in the world, so you'll have to do with some alternatives.

You can electrolyze aluminum dust out of §a§3§agreen sapphire§r or §9sapphire§r. When you hit MV, you can extract aluminum out of clay, but we can't do that yet.

Let's get 3 aluminium ingots to complete this quest.

And by the way, it's aluminIum, not aluminum.

Extract §6silicon dioxide §rfrom sand using the electrolyzer, and then electrolyze it again for §bsilicon§  §rdust. Smelt it in the EBF to get the ingot.

§rWe'll need silicon for getting Tier 3 circuits, so let's get started.

Getting §6gallium §ris required for our next tier of circuits. 

Macerate §6Sphalerite Ore §rto get crushed sphalerite, then hammer it to get an impure pile of sphalerite dust. After this, put it in a centrifuge to get tiny dusts of gallium.
You can get arsenic from electrolyzing §9cobaltite§r. Just don't breath too much of it.
Combine Gallium and Arsenic to get gallium arsenide. You'll need it for diodes, which are the next step to get MV circuits.

Diodes are one of the vital components of MV circuits, they are made with gallium and some copper wires. Let's make 4.

§3You can also use a more efficient Assembler recipe to make 2 diodes with Gallium Arsenide, if you want.

GregTech circuits are weirder than you think. Instead of a single circuit per tier, there are now three to four variants per tier each with a different recipe chain of varying material costs and machine requirements.

There are around 15 different variants of circuits in this pack, the first one being §6primitive circuits§r. Each circuit line has 3 or 4 circuits you can craft that get progressively more expensive. 

So, let's combine 4 §6primitive circuits§,,§r some diodes and some wire into a §6primitive assembly§r. You'll get a cheaper recipe for making MV circuits once you get a LV circuit assembler.

§3This will unlock Tier 3.
