betterquesting:10.desc:8: §3Soldering Alloy §ris an alloy made out of 9 Tin and 1 Antimony. It can be used as a substitute for tin or lead in the circuit recipes.

The §lSteam Oven §ris a multiblock oven that smelts up to 8 items at once. Hurray, multi smelter!

It requires:
8 Bronze Firebox Casings
8 Bronze Plated Brick Casings
1 Steam Hatch
1 Input Bus (Steam)
1 Output Bus (Steam)
1 Steam Oven Controller

If you want to know how to assemble it, look at the §lMultiblock Preview §rtab in JEI.

Good luck!

The §lSteam Grinder §ris a multiblock macerator that smelts up to 8 items at once. 

It requires:
22 Bronze Plated Brick Casings
1 Steam Hatch
1 Input Bus (Steam)
1 Output Bus (Steam)
1 Steam Oven Controller

It's a 3x3x3 structure, with the controller on the center of one of the faces. 
The input and output busses go on the sides of the controller.

Good luck!

betterquesting:10.name:8: I know what you're thinking about. *BONK*
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Lubricant can be distilled from creosote oil, or it can be created by mixing §6oil §rand §6soapstone§r, or talc.
Soapstone is an ore that can be found in the Overworld, at Y levels 20 to 50.

betterquesting:10.name:8: I wonder what it tastes like
betterquesting:10.desc:8: 20mB of §6lubricant§r, 4980mB of §bwater§r, and 1 stone dust in a mixer make Drilling Fluid. This is required for LV miners.
The LV §3chunk miner §rwill automatically mine ores under it. It takes 1mB of drilling fluid per tick, so make sure to bring a lot of it!

The §6Fluid Compressor/Decompressor §r(or FCD for short) compresses gas. You will need it for making liquid air, for superconductors.

Making liquid gasses is the same process for every gas, but we'll do it using liquid air. You can use whatever gas you want in this process, and it'll be the same.
§3This is the start of a 10 step chain. Good luck! :)

When you compress a gas, it heats up. So we will let it cool down to room temperature, and when you'll decompress it, it will be colder. That's also how it works in real life.

Let's compress some air.

The Radiator is a multiblock that cools hot fluids and hot gasses down. 

It requires 

54 Radiator Block
7 Fluid Pipe
2 Light Engineering Block

If you want to know how to build it, look at the schematic in the §6Engineer's Manual§r. 
After completing the structure, whack the Light Engineering Block with an §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.
The radiator can also be built horizontally.
Cool down your §6hot high pressure air §rusing the radiator.

The Heat Exchanger is a multiblock structure that quickly moves heat from one fluid to another.

It requires:
18 Iron Sheetmetal
10 Fluid Pipe
9 Steel Scaffolding
5 Radiator Block
2 Light Engineering Block
1 Redstone Engineering Block

If you want to know how to build it, look at the schematic in the §6Engineer's Manual§r. 
After completing the structure, whack it with an §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

Use the §2Heat Exchanger §rto transfer the heat from the hot gas to the water. This will cool down the gas.

You don't need to use water for this, any coolant will do.
You can use a radiator to cool down the warm coolant, so you can put it in the Heat Exchanger again.

Refrigerants are things that cool fluids or gases to below room temperature. You can use §6Ammonia§r as a refrigerant, it's the easiest one to make. If you don't know how to make ammonia, check the chemistry tab.

So you know how to cool fluids by now.  
First of all compress the ammonia, put it in a radiator to cool it down, and put it in an FCD to make cold refrigerant.

Use the cold ammonia in a §3Heat Exchanger §rto get cold high pressure gas. 

This will also heat up the ammonia, so you can run it again through the cooling system.

I already told you that decompressing gasses cools them down.

So what happens if you decompress an already cold gas? It turns into liquid. Let's make liquid air!

Once you've used your liquid air (for superconductors, or for something else), you will get back normal air. You can run it through the system again to get liquid air, so this entire system is a loop!
The §6Weapons Factory §rmakes guns, turrets, ammo, and other weapon-related items. If you want to defend yourself, you'll need it.

If you want to make turrets, you'll need turret bases. Let's make some.

They are a tiered block that acts as the base for turrets. They use §cRF §renergy. You can put Turrets on all sides of the block, just note that every turret needs a minimum tier of base to be able to be placed. 

All the settings for a modular turret is being stored and set in the base that holds the turrets. In their GUI you should find most descriptions pretty easily (Tooltips are still WIP).
Turret Chambers and Barrels will be required to make turret heads. Let's make some.

The Gun Turret shoots at whatever gets into a 18 block radius of it. It needs a Tier 2 or higher turret base. 

It uses §4100 RF§r (6.25 EU) per shot, and it shoots 2.5 times per second.

It uses bullets as ammo.

The Incendiary Turret yeets fire at whatever gets into a 18 block radius of it. It needs a Tier 2 or higher turret base. 

It uses §4250 RF§r (14.8 EU) per shot, and it shoots 0.8 times per second.

It uses flaming clay as ammo.

The §6Pistol §ris one of the guns you can make at LV tier. It uses pistol magazines as ammo, and has a reload time of 1.75 seconds.

For more info, look at the tooltip.

The §6Combat Shotgun §ris one of the guns you can make at LV tier. It uses shotgun magazines as ammo, and has a reload time of 2.5 seconds. It's also multishot, this means it will shoot 8 times at once.

For more info, look at the tooltip.

The §6Excavator§r is a complex multiblock structure that is able to dig up mineral deposits that are inaccessible with normal mining (they're below bedrock!)

The Excavator requires:
26 Steel Scaffolding
15 Steel Sheetmetal
9 Block of Steel (Immersive Engineering variant)
9 Light Engineering Block
5 Heavy Engineering Block
3 Radiator Block
1 Redstone Engineering Block

The Excavator uses §c4096 RF/t§r (§6256§r EU/t), so you'll need 8 LV generators or 2 MV ones to power it.

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help. 
After putting together the structure, whack it with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

You may have noticed that the §6§rdeposits you mined with the §6Excavator§r are... §7rocks?§r They need to be sorted before we can turn them into normal ores. 

The §6Ore Sorter§r is a complex multiblock structure that breaks down the Excavator's deposits into normal GT Ores.

The Ore Sorter requires

1 Ore Sorter Controller
3 LV Input Busses
3 LV Output Busses
1 LV Energy Hatch
1 LV Input Hatch
1 LV Output Hatch
18 Robot Arm Blocks
4 Electric Pump Blocks
3 Steel Pipe Blocks
18 Factory Blocks (Massive Fan) (If they don't form, try using an Ender Offset Wand)
188 Steel Sheetmetal
80 Iron Sheetmetal

The Ore Sorter uses §632 EU/t§r.

You know what to do. Make an MV Machine Hull.

§6Don't forget to put your MV machinery separate from your LV machinery. If you accidentally mix up the cables, you might create an explosion! 

§r----------------------------------------
§b§3STAGE 3 HAS BEEN UNLOCKED! GOOD LUCK.
§r----------------------------------------
- Change the landscape around you to fit your needs
- Use toxic chemicals against your enemies
- Build more powerful and longer ranged missiles
- Mow down monsters with automatic weapons

Tier: 2
EU/t: 128 
----------------------------------------
Make an MV Electric Motor.
Make an MV Electric Piston.
Make a MV Electric Pump.
Make a MV Robot Arm.
Make an MV Conveyor Module.

The §6Large Weapons Factory §ris a multiblock that makes more advanced weapons like ICBMs. This allows you to do an extremely high amount of trolling on your enemies.

The Large Weapons Factory requires:

1 Large Weapons Factory controller
8 Input Bus
3 Input Hatch
1 Output Bus
1 Energy Input Hatch
68 Lead Metal Casing
67 Steel Frame
8 Factory Blocks (Rusty Scaffold)

It's time to make §6ICBM§rs. 

You can make ICBMs in the §6Large Weapons Factory§o§r. Tier 1 ICBMs use saltpeter as explosive and glucose (aka sugar) as fuel.

You'll need to make a Tier 1 Launcher Platform and a Tier 1 Control Panel. We'll get to making the actual explosives in another quest.
If you want more accuracy, add a Tier 1 Support Frame to the launching structure.

The §6Railroad Engineering Station §ris a multiblock that makes equipment for Immersive Railroading. The IR multiblocks are huge and clunky, so this is a pretty good alternative.

The Railroad Engineering Station requires:

1 Railroad Engineering Station controller
8 Input Bus
3 Input Hatch
1 Output Bus
1 Energy Input Hatch
55 Steel Metal Casing
14 Steel Frame

The Immersive Engineering §6gas turbine§r is a multiblock that produces §4kinetic energy §r(not normal energy) from fluids and gases. It needs an alternator to work.
(Not to be confused with the GregTech gas turbine, which is just a single block generator)

The Gas Turbine requires:

20 Steel Sheetmetal
16 Heavy Engineering Block
8 High-Voltage Coil Block
8 Steel Block (If the structure doesn't form, try using an Immersive Engineering steel block. Use a Chisel to change between types)
3 Steel Sheetmetal Slab
3 Steel Scaffolding
2 Fluid Pipes
1 Redstone Engineering Block

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help on how to build the structure.

After putting together the structure, whack the Steel Block (the one on the short side) with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

The Alternator is a multiblock structure that turns §6kinetic energy§r into electricity.
It needs to have a Kinetic Energy generator connected to it to work (like the Gas Turbine).

The Alternator requires:

9 Light Engineering Block
8 Generator Block
4 High Voltage Coil Block
4 Radiator Block
4 Steel Sheetmetal
2 Steel Blocks
2 Heavy Engineering Block

The Alternator can store up to 1.200.000 RF, outputting §c2048 RF/t§r (64 EU/t)

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help on how to build the structure.
§r
After putting together the structure, whack the Heavy Engineering Block with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

The §6Steam Turbine§r is a multiblock that uses Steam to produce §ckinetic energy§r (it needs an alternator to be turned into RF)
.
Not to be confused with the GT steam turbine, which is a singleblock generator.

The Steam Turbine requires:
27 Steel Sheetmetal
24 Heavy Engineering Block
10 Steel Block
6 Fluid Pipes
4 Radiator Block
3 Steel Scaffolding
1 Redstone Engineering Block.

You can check the §6Engineer's Manual§r for help on how to build the structure.

After putting together the structure, whack the Steel Block (the one on the short side) with the §6Engineer's Hammer §rto form the multiblock.

Making §6dynamite §ris an expensive chemical process (we can't make TNT yet, we'll need §3polyethylene§r for that). First of all start by making Nitration Mixture.
Mix together Sulfuric Acid and Nitric Acid.
§6Methanol§r is made by combining §6CO2§r with §6Hydrogen§r. Remember, you'll need a MV chemical reactor for this.

§6Seed Oil §rcan be extracted by plants using a Fluid Extractor. Let's make some.


§3
Use your Fluid Extractor to extract §bFish Oil §rfrom fish.
The §6LV Fluid Extractor§r... extracts fluids out of other materials (duh). For example, you can extract §aseed oil §rout of plants, or fish oil from fish.

Make §6glycerol§r and §3biodiesel §rby mixing methanol and seed/fish oil. 

You'll need glycerol for making dynamite, but Biodiesel can also be used as a source of power.
Remember that the reaction needs 1 tiny pile of §3Sodium Hydroxide§r, which is made by - you guessed it - sodium and water.
Making §6glyceryl trinitrate §ris the final step for making dynamite. Combine your Glycerol and the Nitration Mixture to get it.
Make §cDynamite§r using §6Glyceryl Trinitrate§r, some paper and some string in a chemical reactor. You have explosives now, don't use them in dangerous ways...
Your LV Chemical Reactor isn't powerful enough to make all reactions, so you'll need to upgrade it to make things like explosives. Make an MV Chemical Reactor.

Your LV electrolyzer isn't powerful enough to electrolyze everything - so we'll have to upgrade it.

With an MV electrolyzer you can electrolyze clay (§e§elol! funny balance!§r), which will yield copious amounts of lithium and aluminium.
Electrolyzing 13 dusts of the §afunny substance §rwill yield 2 sodium, 2 aluminium, 2 silicon and 1 lithium, along with 6 buckets of water. Let's do it.

§cCondensed Explosives §rare made with 8 dynamites and some wire, and they are the most important component in making ICBM explosives. You will need a lot of those.

§3You will need dynamite for this, which is a 5 step chemical chain. Check the Chemistry Tab if you want a guide.

betterquesting:10.name:8: My Dad Is A War Criminal!
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You can make §6Chemical Explosives§r by combining Condensed Explosives with either sulfuric acid or chlorine in the LWF. 

Remember that you can attach those on a missile too if you want to troll your enemies from a long distance.
§cIncendiary explosives§o§r are made with normal Condensed Explosives and naphtha. They set fire to everything they touch.
The §6Shrapnel Explosive§r will yeet thousands of little shards of metal at the player unfortunate enough to receive them. It's pretty easy to make, iot's Condensed Explosives + 8 Lead Rounds.
§6Debilitation explosives§r will make everything that touches it nauseous, and very confused. It's made with Condensed Explosives and Sulfur Dioxide.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Is that a bird? OH SHI-
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The §6Anvil Explosive§r will yeet an anvil to anyone unfortunate enough to touch it. It's pretty simple to make, 8 anvils + condensed explosive.

§6Phosphorus §rcan be obtained via a two-step process from phosphor ore. First of all, electrolyze the Phosphor Dust into Calcium and Tricalcium Phosphate, then electrolyze the tricalcium phosphate to get pure Phosphorus.
§6Calcium §rcan be electrolyzed from a lot of dusts. You can use Phosphor dust, but also Calcite, Lazurite, or others. Check JEI for more info.
You can get §cChrome §rby electrolyzing §cRuby§r (found in Redstone veins), or Chromite and Uvarovite dusts, which aren't available right now.

You can obtain §7Manganese§r by electrolyzing Spessartine or Grossular dusts, you can get them by mining in Grossular veins in the Beneath.

You'll need manganese for stainless steel, so make sure to have a lot of it!
§9Fluid Cells §rfrom GregTech can be used to store liquids in an item form. They're useful, so let's make some.

betterquesting:10.name:8: "so what, you can see THROUGH IT?"
betterquesting:10.desc:8: You can use your furnace to turn sand into §6glass§r and make water bottles.

§6Stainless Steel §ris the material we'll need for all HV hulls and components. Stainless Steel dust is made of Iron, Chrome, Manganese and Nickel. Throw the dust in an EBF and wait for it to cook. 

Note: If you want your EBF to cook faster, you can use MV energy hatches, and 4 MV generators. This will increase the EBF's power input to 480 EU/t, making it run at HV.
1 §7Carbon§r + 2 §9Oxygen§o§r = 3 §8Carbon Dioxide§r. Easy, right?

§6Oilsands Ore §ris basically oil in stone form. If you can't find an oil deposit, you can try extracting the oil from this. Oilsands veins are found at height levels 1-60 of the Beneath, with a weight of 80.

Getting the LV Circuit Assembler will open up the path to §6Electronic Circuits§r. Electronic Circuits are a completely new type of circuit that function on completely different technology than your Primitive Circuits.

There are 3 circuits in the Electronic Circuit processing line. The Electronic Processor (LV) is much cheaper than your Primitive Processor. The Electronic Assembly (MV) is also cheaper than the Primitive Assembly. The Electronic Computer is the first HV circuit you can get in the game, so we will work on that.
Make a §6CPU Wafer§r, we'll need it for our Electronic Circuits. You'll need to make a whole CPU wafer (by engraving a blank wafer with a glass lens) first and then cut it with a Cutting Machine.
We will need §6phenolic circuit boards §rfor our next set of circuits. These are made with Glue (which is made by centrifuging Resin), or with Bisphenol A, which is unlocked later.

betterquesting:10.name:8: This will take a very, very long time.
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
We will need §6silicon wafers §rfor our next set of circuits, so let's get started. You have to make a §6Monocrystalline Silicon Boule §rby inserting 32 Silicon Dust and 1 dust of §aGallium Arsenide §rin your EBF. 

§3This recipe will take 9 minutes. Good luck.

To make circuits, we'll need wafers. (I'm not talking about the German cookie, I'm talking about the silicon §othing§r).

Making blank wafers is easy, you just need to slice your Monocrystalline Silicon Boule using a §6Cutting Machine§r. (Remember to make an MV one, you'll need it later)

Also don't forget that wafers unlock an easier assembler recipe for Diodes. That's pretty cool.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Don't put your hand inside it
betterquesting:10.desc:8: You need a §6MV Laser Engraver §rto make electronic circuit wafers. Let's make it.

betterquesting:10.name:8: I fear no man, but that thing... it scares me.
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The §6Pyrolyse Oven §ris a GregTech multiblock that is used to make Coal Tar from Coal, or Charcoal from Logs, or §b§aFermented Biomass §rfrom plantballs.

The Pyrolyse Oven needs:

1 Pyrolyse Oven Controller
16 Cupronickel Coil Blocks
1 input bus (any tier, but you need LV to complete this quest)
1 input hatch (any tier)
1 output bus (any tier)
1 output hatch (any tier)
1 Maintenance Hatch
1 LV Energy Input Hatch (we can't get the MV one right now)
12 ULV Machine Casings (that's §eUltra Low Voltage§r, don't get confused with the LV one)

You will need the Pyrolyse Oven to make fermented biomass, for our next tier of plastic. Good luck! :)

Here's which tools you need to fix the maintenance problems in your multiblocks:

------------------------------------------
Possible problems                  Tool to fix
------------------------------------------
"Pipe is loose."                        Wrench
"Screws are missing."             Screwdriver 
"Something is stuck."               Soft mallet 
"Platings are dented."              Hammer 
"Circuitry burned out."           Wire Cutter 
"That doesn't belong there."       Crowbar

betterquesting:10.name:8: Enough power to sustain any Aperture Science™ personality constructs.
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Greg-Tech(TM) §6BrainTech Aerospace Advanced Reinforced Duct Tape FAL-84 §rwill fix all maintenance problem with just one click! Try it!
Use the Pyrolyse Oven to turn §aPlantballs §rinto §2Fermented Biomass§r.
You'll need an §2MV Distillery §rfor turning your Fermented Biomass into Ethanol.
Distill §7Ethanol §rout of §2Fermented Biomass§r, we'll need it for our next tier of plastic.
§7Ethanol §r+ §6Sulfuric Acid §rin an *MV* chemical reactor will give you Ethylene. We only have 1 more step to go to get tier 2 plastic!

§7Ethylene §r+ §bOxygen §r(or air) in a Chemical Reactor will make §7Polyethylene§r, the 2nd tier of plastic in SUPERSYMMETRY. You can use it to make HV cables, or capacitors for HV circuits, or Geneva-conventions-banned grenades.

...so let's bomb [DATA MISSING]! The latest advances in GregTech(TM) technology allows us to make deadly §6gas grenades§r with polyethylene. Let's try it with §achlorine§r! Woo, war crimes!

§oThe developers of SUPERSYMMETRY are not responsible for any damages from using this item. For more information, see [REDACTED].

pages:9.0:8: {"text":"The Geneva Conventions are four treaties, and three additional protocols, that establish international legal standards for humanitarian treatment in war. "}
pages:9.1:8: {"text":"The singular term Geneva Convention usually denotes the agreements of 1949, negotiated in the aftermath of the Second World War (1939–1945), which updated the terms of the two 1929 treaties and added two conventions. "}
pages:9.2:8: {"text":"The Geneva Conventions extensively define the basic rights of wartime prisoners (civilians and military personnel), established protections for the wounded and sick, and provided protections for the civilians in and around a war zone;"}
pages:9.3:8: {"text":"moreover, the Geneva Convention also defines the rights and protections afforded to non-combatants. Thee treaties of 1949 were ratified, in their entirety or with reservations, by 196 countries.[1] "}
pages:9.4:8: {"text":"The Geneva Conventions concern only combatants in war; they do not address the use of weapons of war, which is the subject of the Hague Conventions[a] and the bio-chemical warfare Geneva Protocol.[b]\n\n"}

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§6Capacitors §rare one of the basic components of Electronic Circuits. Let's make some!

You can also use Refined SMD Capacitors in place of normal Capacitors, if you want to increase your yield with an extra step.

betterquesting:10.name:8: You're in for one HELL of a ride.
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The §6Electronic Processor §ris the first circuit in the Electronic circuit line. It's an LV circuit, and it's much cheaper to make than the Primitive Processor.

§6Transistors§r are another vital component of Electronic Circuits. Let's make some.

You can also use Refined SMD Transistors in place of normal Transistors, if you want.
Make an §6Electronic Assembly§r in the Circuit Assembler. It's an MV circuit, and a much cheaper one than the Primitive Assembly.
§6Integrated Circuit Wafers§r are needed to make our first HV circuit. You need a §cred lens §rfor engraving them, Ruby is the easiest one to get at this stage.

§rIt's time to make our first HV circuit! It's called the Electronic Computer. I'm not going to tell you anything, you're experienced enough that you can just use JEI. Good luck!

§3This will unlock Tier 4.

betterquesting:10.name:8: New advancements in cock and ball circuitry
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You can make diodes with §6polyethylene§r and foils now. 

Refined SMD Diodes act as normal Diodes, but they are much cheaper to make and the recipe yields more.

You can make resistors with §6polyethylene§r and foils now. 

Refined SMD Resistors act as normal Resistors, but they are much cheaper to make and the recipe yields more.

betterquesting:10.name:8: It's even funnier the second time!!
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Building an MV Circuit Assembler will unlock §6Refined Circuits§r, the third type of circuit in SUPERSYMMETRY.

There are 4 circuits in the Refined Circuit Line.
We have the §bRefined Processor §r(LV), the §bRefined Assembly §r(MV), the §bRefined Computer §r(HV) and the §bRefined Mainframe§r (EV). Yes, you read that right. You can make Tier 5 circuits at Tier 3.

This is the only way to get EV circuits at the moment. Remember that from this point on, you can always make circuits 2 tiers ahead of your current tier. For example, when you reach HV, you can make IV circuits.

The Refined Circuits are even cheaper than the electronic circuits, so this is an easy way to get lots of low-tier circuits.

§oMan, I really said the word "circuit" a lot, right?
If you want to make the next tier of circuits, you'll need plastic circuit boards. Let's make some.

Sodium Persulfate will be needed to etch your next circuit board. Making it is a two-step process:

Salt + Sulfuric Acid = Sodium Bisulfate and Hydrochloric Acid

Sodium Bisulfate gives Sodium Persulfate in the Electrolyzer.

Now we're finally starting to get to actual circuit boards. The first one was just a piece of resin on a stick. The second one was a solidified piece of glue. Now we're using actual CHEMICALS with FUNNY BIG WORDS to make them. Isn't it nice?

§3Make the Good Circuit Board.
Make the first Refined Circuit, the Refined Processor.
Make the second stage of Refined Circuits, the Refined Assembly.
Make the Refined Computer, the 3rd tier of Refined Circuits.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Advanced BrainTech(TM) Salami Cutting Machine V2.0
betterquesting:10.desc:8: You'll need an §6MV Cutting Machine §rto slice the finished wafers into wafer chips. Let's make it.
Make a §6RAM Wafer§r, we'll need it for our Refined Supercomputer.

Make a Refined Mainframe, the first ever EV-tier circuit you can make in SUPERSYMMETRY.

Good luck!
Make Glue from putting sticky resin in a centrifuge. You'll need a lot of it for MV circuits.

betterquesting:10.name:8: You're probably getting used to this.
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Make an HV Electric Motor to progress into HV Tier.

§3You will need polyethylene for this. Make the Pyrolyse Oven to get it.

HV §6Gold Cables §rneed polyethylene to be fully insulated. Let's make some.

You can also use polyethylene in place of polycaprolactam in MV cable recipes.

Now that you have unlocked stainless steel, you are able to produce even better missiles. The problem is... they require liquid oxygen, which is NOT an easy substance to get access to. Getting Liquid Oxygen is a 9-step chain. Look at the Cryogenics tab for more info.

But for now, let's make a Tier 2 Launcher Platform.
The Fragmentation Missile will explode into about 20 smaller pieces of explosives when it hits the ground.
The Thermobaric Missile is as close as we can get to a nuke, without actually using nuclear power. It makes a big hole.

betterquesting:10.name:8: For when you need a door
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Breaching Missile will rip a huge hole in whatever structure you're launching it at. Useful if you need a back door.
The Contagious Missile will spawn a bunch of zombies to wherever you're launching it.
The Sonic Missile will obliterate any person's ears if they get close to the landing site.
The §6MV Weapons Factory §rmakes higher-tier weapons, ammo, and turret gear. Let's make it.

betterquesting:10.name:8: It'll fail, just like the platform
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
If you want to use diesel, you need to mix light fuel and heavy fuel, and you can only do that with an §6MV Mixer§r.

By the way, don't forget to get an MV diesel generator, if you want to use diesel at MV.

The §6Mac 10§r is the first submachine gun you can make in this modpack. It uses §6SMG Magazines §ras ammo. It has a dual-wield penalty, this means it will make less damage if you're using it with two hands. Look at the tooltip for more info.

The §6Thompson SMG§r is another submachine gun you can make at MV. It uses §6SMG Magazines §ras ammo. It's a two handed gun. 

Look at the tooltip for more info.

The §6AKM§r is the first assault rifle you can make in this modpack. It uses §6Assault Rifle Magazines §ras ammo. 

For more info, look at the tooltip.

The §6M4§r is another assault rifle you can make at MV. It uses §6Assault Rifle Magazines §ras ammo. It's also a two-handed gun. 

For more info, look at the tooltip.
MV turrets will be much more powerful than MV ones, so let's get started. You'll need Tier 3 turret chambers, turret bases, and turret barrels.

The Grenade Launcher Turret is pretty simple, it *YOINKS* grenades at whatever gets into a 25 block radius of it. It needs a Tier 3 or higher turret base. 

It uses §48 000 RF§r (500 EU) per shot, and it shoots 2.5 times per second.

It uses grenades as ammo.

betterquesting:10.name:8: This has nothing to do with relativity.
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The §6Relativistic Turret §rslows down all targetable entities in range. The effect becomes stronger the closer the target is to the turret. It does not consume ammo.
§4Coal Tar§r is made by putting coal, charcoal, lignite, or coal coke into a §6pyrolyse oven§r. Coal Tar opens up a lot of chemical chains, that we will see in the next quests.

Circuits in Gregicality are defined by two characteristics: their §6technological level§r (electronic, quantum, optical, etc,) and their "rank" in a given §6technology tier§r (assembly, mainframe, etc.)

These two characteristics give a circuit its name and voltage tier (e.g. the Micro Computer, an EV circuit and the 3rd micro circuit.)

The first technological tier of circuits, primitive circuits, is crafted by hand. The following tiers are fabricated in Circuit Assemblers, or the Assembly Line for high-end assemblies, computers and mainframes. Circuits at the Quantum tier or higher require the Large Circuit Assembly Line, craftable using LuV circuits (the first of which is the Nano Mainframe.)

Higher technological tiers demand more complex processing chains for their respective components, but generally follow similar patterns in terms of what components they require (SMDs, circuit boards, metal frames for mainframes, etc.) Technological advancement will also allow you to make previous circuits more efficiently (e.g. using SoCs to craft Refined Processors without through-hole/SMD components.)

{ResourceLocation:supersymmetry:guides/circuits.png}
Making §6Polyvinyl Chloride§r, or PVC, will only require two extra steps from Ethylene. First of all, you make Vinyl Chloride, by mixing Ethylene with Chlorine or Hydrochloric Acid.

Now that you have your Vinyl Chloride, you just have to §opolymerize §rit to turn it into PVC. 

Polymerizing is just a really fancy chemistry word for "blasting the thing with oxygen or air". I've probably said something horribly wrong in that sentence, but it makes sense for GregTech. I just make quests, I'm not a chemist.

Anyways, PVC is §6THE best early game material for pipes§r. If your pipes aren't good enough, you should probably make PVC ones.

§6Benzene §ris a good source of power in the MV age. One bucket of Benzene gives 288,000 EU, lasting 1:52 minutes in an MV gas turbine, or almost 8 minutes in an LV gas turbine.

Benzene can also be used in an Immersive Engineering gas turbine, or in an IE Steam Boiler.

The §6Cracker Unit §ris a GregTech multiblock that is used to thermally crack heavy hydrocarbons into lighter fractions. This machine allows Light or Heavy Fuel to be further distilled into the lighter fractions, or into the secondary products Toluene and Lubricant more efficiently.

The Cracking Unit needs:

1 Cracker Unit Controller
16 Cupronickel Coil Blocks
1 input hatch (any tier)
1 output hatch (any tier)
1 Maintenance Hatch
1 LV Energy Input Hatch (we can't get the MV one right now)
20 Stainless Steel Metal Casings

The Cracker Unit also allows a more efficient route for getting polyethylene, but we'll see that in another quest.

§6Propene §ris another hydrocarbon that you can make using the Cracker Unit. First of all make either Steam-Cracked Light Fuel or Steam-Cracked Naphtha, then distill them into Propene.

§3Don't confuse Propene with Propane. They're NOT the same thing. §r

You can make §6polyethylene §reven easier if you have the Cracking Unit. 

You just have to get Steam Cracked Light Fuel, then distill it to Ethylene, and add oxygen or air to make it Polyethylene.

The §6Distillation Tower§r is a GregTech multiblock that distills huge amounts of fluids. It is an advanced version of the Distillery, able to output all products at the same time and with greater energy efficiency and throughput.

The Distillation Tower needs:

1 Cracker Unit Controller
1 input hatch (any tier)
5+ output hatch (any tier) (you need more output hatches if you want to extract more than 5 fluids at once)
1 Maintenance Hatch
1 Muffler Hatch
1 LV Energy Input Hatch (we can't get the MV one right now)
39 Stainless Steel Metal Casings

The Cracker Unit also allows a more efficient route for getting polyethylene, but we'll see that in another quest.
If you want to assemble more advanced machine components, like engines, or MV circuit stuff, you will need an MV Assembler.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Tier 4 - How the hell do I get titanium?
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You know the drill. Make an HV Machine Hull.

§6Don't forget to put your HV machinery separate from your LV and MV machinery. If you accidentally mix up the cables, you might create an explosion! 

§r----------------------------------------
§b§3STAGE 4 HAS BEEN UNLOCKED! GOOD LUCK.
§r----------------------------------------
- Reach the maximum potential range of your missiles
- Find new metallurgic processes to obtain titanium
- Unlock flying vehicles to conquer the skies

Tier: 4
EU/t: 512
----------------------------------------

Do you want to start operating heavy machinery? 

This questline will teach you how to create heavy machinery from TechStack's Machinery Mod. Let's start by making Zircon Mold dust.

We'll need §6Zircon §rdust (found in the beneath) and some glue. You'll need to mix those together in an LV mixer.

To make an Engine Block, you'll need a §6MV Forming Press§r. Let's make one.

And no, you can't use your old LV forming press, as the recipe requires 60 EU/t.
LV machines can take between 0 and 32 EU/t. MV ones can take between 0 and 128 EU/t.
Making an engine is quite an involved process, let's start by making the Engine Block cast.

Now that you made the engine block cast, it's time to fill it with aluminum. Yep, it's just like Tinker's Construct!

But to do that, you'll need an §2MV §rfluid canning machine.

To turn the Full Engine Block Cast into a proper Engine Block, you'll need to cook it.

I think 25 seconds in an MV Electric Blast Furnace at 800°K is enough.
Now it's time to fully assemble our Engine. You'll need the Engine Block, but also some other components. Remember that the Camshaft needs an MV Lathe.
The Combine Harvester will automatically harvest your crops.

Need to flatten the land for your farms or clear a forest quickly? This is the machine for you!

The Bulldozer will flatten anything that it comes in contact with. You use WASD to control it.

The Dump Truck will drop items or blocks into the bed of this truck and haul them off over long distances. 

It contains a double chest worth of inventory. 

Once you're at your destination, raise the bed and drop the items out. It's great for delivering ores to your processing station.

Heavy Machinery doesn't run on electricity, it runs on fuel. You can fill up a Fuel Can with a variety of fluids, using the MV fluid canner.

Fuel up the machine with the fuel can by right clicking on the machine with the fuel can in your hand.

Most machines have 2 functions an UP and a DOWN. UP is your Jump key and usually raises a bucket. 
DOWN is your Sprint Key, and it will typically lower a bucket or activate the device like the spreader or the planter plow on the tractor. 
Accessing a machines inventory is done while riding it with your inventory key (E by default).

The Drilling Rig will drill a huge hole. When that is done right click on the hole with§6§r and blow the thing up, you will get blasted stone that you can pick up with a loader. If put in the ore sorter, blasted stone will give all the rock types.
The Lawn Mower will cut tall grass when you drive over it. Now you don't have to spam click to get rid of it!

You can make §dMethane §rin a variety of ways. 

- Combine 4 Hydrogens and 1 Carbon in a Chemical Reactor (not very efficient)
- Centrifuge Rubber Wood or food items
- Get it by distilling oil products (you'll need a Distillation Tower, unlocked at Tier 3)
Some new recipes, like Polytetrafluoroethylene, will need a §dHV Chemical Reactor§r§r. Let's make one.
Make an HV Electric Piston.
Make an HV Electric Pump.
Make an HV Electric Robot Arm.
Make an HV Conveyor Module.

Make an LV Emitter, you'll need it for some more advanced machines. 

Note that this requires §9quartzite§r, which is found in Quartzite veins in the Beneath and in Nether Quartz veins in the Nether.

Make an LV Emitter, you'll need it for some more advanced machines. 

Note that this requires §9quartzite§r, which is found in Quartzite veins in the Beneath and in Nether Quartz veins in the Nether.
Make an MV Emitter, you'll need it for some more advanced machinery later on.
Make an MV Sensor, you'll need it for some more advanced machinery later on.
You can get Fluorine from electrolyzing §bBlue Topaz§r, §6Topaz§r, §7Bastnasite §rand §dLepidolite§r.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Don't inject it in your blood
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Chloroform is made of Methane and Chlorine. It's used to make Polytetrafluoroethylene, the 3rd tier of plastic in GregTech.

If you need help with getting Methane, look at the Chemistry tab.

Hydrofluoric Acid is made by combining Hydrogen and Fluorine (duh). If you need help with getting Fluorine, look at JEI or the Chemistry tab, you're in fucking Tier 4, I shouldn't be telling you this.

Combine Chloroform and Hydrofluoric Acid to make Tetrafluoroethylene. Then polymerize (blast it with air or oxygen) it to get Polytetrafluoroethylene.

Polytetrafluoroethylene is a really complicated and long name. You can just call it PTFE or Teflon.

If you want to upgrade your Electric Blast Furnace, you'll need Kanthal. It's just an Iron + Aluminum + Nickel alloy.

Remember: when you smelt Kanthal, you'll get a Hot Kanthal Ingot, which you'll need to put in the Quenching Machine to cool it down into a normal Kanthal ingot.

Better materials need higher temperatures. You can just exchange the old coils with the new ones. Kanthal coils let you reach 2700 K, enough to smelt titanium. 

You can even reuse the old Cupronickel coils in other machines like the Cracking Unit or Pyrolyse Oven.

§3This quest unlocks at Tier 3.

Now that we're getting to make hotter materials, we will need to cool them to use them. You can't just touch an ingot of titanium at 2300°C.

Introduce: the Quenching Machine. You may think that this extremely advanced, Tier 4 machine just puts ingots in water, but there are actually multiple quenching fluids for better and faster cooling.

These quenching fluids are:

Water:
    +Very easy to get
    +Moderately fast

Air:
    +Very easy to get
    -Very slow

Compressed Air:
    +Easy to get
    -Slow

Inert gases (Nitrogen):
    +Easy to get
    +Can be used to avoid reaction with water/oxygen
    -Very Slow

Compressed inert gases:
    +Moderately easy to get
    +Can be used to avoid reaction with water/oxygen
    -Slow

Quenching oil:
    +Fast
    +Can be used to avoid reaction with water/oxygen
    -Hard to make

Brine:
    +Very fast
    +Very easy to get
    -Some metals do not like the salt and need washing 

-----------------
The Quenching machine requires:

1 Quenching Machine Controller
2 Input Hatch (LV or higher)
2 Output Hatch (LV or higher)
1 Input Bus
2 Output Bus
1 Energy Hatch (LV or higher)
10 Steel Frames
28 Solid Steel Metal Casings
6 Factory Blocks (fast fan)
If you want to upgrade your Electric Blast Furnace even further to reach temperatures up to 3,600°K you'll need Nichrome. It's just a Nickel + Chrome alloy.
If you want to smelt metals at temperatures up to 3,600 K, you'll need to make Nichrome coils. Let's make them.
Since this is a realistic pack, you don't need to go to the End Dimension to get an elytra. You can just make it with PTFE. Isn't that cool?
It's time for us to get §6titanium§o§r. Titanium is found in §5Bauxite§r, §eand §dRutile §r§rores. Smelting Titanium is quite an involved process, so let's try to get the ores first.
§7Magnesium§r can be obtained by electrolyzing Asbestos, Obsidian, Magnesite, Olivine, Pyrope or Talc. We'll need it for the Titanium smelting process, so let's make some!

Smelting titanium is quite an involved process, and it requires a few steps.
Since you can't electrolyze Titanium Dust out of the ores, we'll have to do a few extra steps.

First of all, put Rutile Dust, Carbon and Chlorine in a chemical reactor, it makes this:

Rutile Dust + Carbon + Chlorine => Carbon Monoxide + §6Titanium Tetrachloride§r

You can obtain Chlorine by electrolyzing a lot of Salt, and you can just void the Carbon Monoxide since it isn't that important at this point.

betterquesting:10.name:8: WE FUCKING DID IT GAMERS WE BEAT THE GAME
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Put Titanium and Titanium Tetrachloride in an EBF to smelt it.

This makes a Hot Titanium Ingot, that you will then need to quench to turn into a normal Titanium Ingot.

§3Tier 3 missiles have been unlocked!
We'll need an HV assembler to make more involved components, weapons and elytras. Let's make one.
